intro: Wahlenbergia axillaris, commonly known as the coastal bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is well adapted to sandy soils and saline conditions. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom from spring to early summer. Wahlenbergia axillaris is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in coastal environments.
